s.text: Farsighted educators have shown that you can make superior public schools even in poor neighborhoods.
True, there is a risk that in promoting public-school alternatives, neighborhood schools will be left with the most difficult-to-educate children and not enough resources to meet the task.

In New York, the teachers' union runs a program called Dial-A-Teacher that answers homework questions in English, Spanish, Haitian-Creole, French, Greek, Italian, and Chinese, which is really quite useful.
